DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study compare effect two after-school program child 's physical activity , fitness , body composition , academic performance .
DOC.brief_title: Physical Activity , Weight Fitness Outcomes Children After-Care
DOC.detailed_description: Tennessee rank 4th high prevalence adult obesity nation ( 30.2 % ) , rank 5th high rate youth obesity ( 36.5 % ) . The Division General Pediatrics Vanderbilt specific research focus develop community engagement project measurably reduce childhood obesity . Metro Parks Recreation showcased National Recreation Parks Association ( NRPA ) national model leadership role community health wellness . The two create unique academic-community partnership , guide principal community-based participatory research ( CBPR ) , work test disseminate effective Metro Parks-based program reduce pediatric obesity . The propose study examine impact Coleman Community Center after-school program routine physical activity , weight fitness outcomes child belong low-income racial ethnic minority population high risk childhood obesity . This study request Metro Parks significant policy implication : If program deem effective improve daily physical activity , weight and/or fitness outcome student , propose study serve rationale expand program Metro Parks ' 22 community center , locate under-resourced neighborhood .
